1.text: Select a quality indoor cleaner with ammonia for the glass.

2.text: Mix together equal parts water and vinegar for an all-natural alternative.

3.text: Spray the glass very lightly with a cleaning solution.

4.text: Scrub the glass from side to side using a microfiber cloth.

5.text: Buff any remaining stains with a dry microfiber cloth.

6.text: Eliminate small stains by treating them individually with isopropyl alcohol.

7.text: Select a car glass cleaning product that doesn’t contain ammonia.

8.text: Combine water, isopropyl alcohol, and vinegar to make your own cleaner.

9.text: Spray the cleaner onto exterior glass with a misting bottle.

10.text: Wipe the glass clean with a microfiber cloth.

11.text: Dry the glass with a clean cloth after you are done cleaning it.

12.text: Wipe the interior glass with a dry cloth and no cleaner.

13.text: Degrease the glass with a cloth dampened in isopropyl alcohol.

14.text: Spray cleaner onto a cloth if you’re cleaning interior glass surfaces.
